creator: cowwoc@bbs.darktech.org
text:
Using Tomcat under Netbeans; they include v4.04 final as far as I know..

   When I try compiling a JSP containing this line:

<jsp:setProperty name="counter" property="appBase" value="<%=
application.getRealPath("") %>" />

   I get "Attribute  has no value"

The cause of the bug seems to be <%= application.getRealPath("") %>.. When you
remove it, the problem goes away.

You'll need to escape the quote '"' in

	value="<%=application.getRealPath("") %>"

or use a single quote for the value.
creator: kin-man.chung@sun.com
cowwoc@bbs.darktech.org
text:
Request for clarification:

1) How does one escape the quotes?
2) Where in the JSP spec does it specify quotes need to be escaped? This works
on all other JSP containers.

Please read JSP.2.6 Quoting and Escape Conventions.

You should use

	value="<%=application.getRealPath(\"\") %>"

What "other JSP containers" allow such ill-formed attribute value to work?  If
they do, you should file bug against them. :-)
